title: SoC RTVF 373-0-20 Topics in Sound
topic: Communicating Sound Science with Sound Media

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The class will focus on the production of podcasts that effectively communicate concepts from the field of Auditory Neuroscience. Special attention will be given to podcast production techniques, writing about scientific topics for a general audience, and using sound as an expressive medium for communicating ideas that are difficult to convey verbally. Auditory neuroscientist Dr. Nina Kraus and radio historian Dr. Neil Verma will contribute lectures and critique during the production process.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? To develop the basic skills of podcasting production, including scripting, interviewing, recording, mixing, and editing
? To understand concepts from the field of Auditory Neuroscience, and learn about how to effectively communicate them to a broad audience
? To learn techniques and tools for working with sound as an expressive and communicative medium

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be evaluated on their participation in class, their contributions to the production process, and on the final podcast segments that are produced.
